column4: I have a problem, the entries that I put in the Startup Programs part of System>Preferences>Sessions get erased when I reboot.
I removed the Beagle Desktop client, and added Pidgin to startup, and when I rebooted Beagle started up and no Pidgin.
and then when I checked, none of my changes stayed in the startup thing
So does anybody know what is wrong?
So does anybody know what that is happening?
Why don't my startup entries stay?
I always found that to be annoying
Is there a way to fix it?
you can have all the things you want to start running already then save session
add the entries aswell to make doubly sure
did you try what I said
it still ultimately the exact same thing
but hey, must be a bug with certain installs....unless you want to get into the guts of it and fix it file a bug on launchpad I have
have you tried the forums? the way I said works perfectly...I mean how many times are you going to need to change your startup entries at high speed?
I've checked the forums, I guess I'll post a thread or something
I just want to know why this isn't working. All well and good if saving the session works, but I would prefer to find a solution to this problem.
as I said though my desktop has a similar bug and I dont think many ppl would no which file that writes to
bugs a bug learn to program if you want to no why its not working
It may not be a bug, it may be a permission error, which is exactly why I'm asking the question.
either way you'd be quicker tinkering yourself
your the only other person besides me that I know of anyway that has encountered this problem
